Yeah, I've seen a couple now. I still think what I said stands because most of those aren't upvoted and the top comments (from both people who like/dislike Trump) are all condemning this.

I literally can't find a single "wow this was a great thing to do" comment in this thread, and the general consensus among both sides seems to be that this was boneheaded. Not sure why the "tolerant left" zinger is coming out in such full force.

That's the thing. I hate Trump, but this was a completely brainless move. If you celebrate this, all you're gonna do is fuel the right and give them more ammo to bash how "tolerant" the left is, as is being done in this thread as I type.
Can someone explain why people got so mad about his James Rolfe tweet? His comment was dickish, but I don't really see why it was worth being shredded over.

I'd be down for another Rentals album. If anyone in here hasn't heard Return of the Rentals, you're missing out, it's a great album, and definitely very Blue Album-y. The other two aren't as good (Seven More Minutes in particular is definitely a hot mess) but still worth hearing.
This is their first year eligible. A band's debut album has to be 25 years old before they can be nominated, and Ten came out in 1991.
